message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Sofosbuvir is an antiviral medication used to treat hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection. Its mechanism of action is to inhibit RNA-dependent RNA polymerase, which is essential for the replication of the HCV RNA genome. This stops the replication of the virus, leading to a reduction in viral load and improved liver function in patients with chronic HCV infection.
